name: Marvel Comic Book Collection: X-Men, Volume 2 (2-Disc) (Full Frame)
categoryPath: Movies & TV/TV Shows/Anime & Animation/Anime for Children

reviews.name: Marvel Comic Book Collection: X-Men, Volume 2 (2-Disc) (Full Frame)
reviews.reviewText:
I loved this show growing up so when the DVD series came out, I was very excited! This X-Men the Animated Series Volume 2 DVD has a great episode list (see the following). However, the episodes from the DVD are shown not in order of original air date from FOX kids. The episodes on this DVD include :
Red Dawn - Omega Red is brought back bring order and control over Russia with unforeseen results.
Repo Man - Wolverine's Canadian Combat team, Alpha Flight, ambushes him to learn the secret of how he survived the anamantium bonding process.
X-Ternally Yours - Gambit is coerced into returning to Louisiana to help his brother,the X-men go to help.
Time Fugitives 1&2 - Cable stops Apokolips' and the Friends of Humanity's Plagues while saving future human/ mutant generations.
A Rogues Tale - Rouge's childhood date comes back offering a chance at romance... with strings attached.
Beauty & The Beast - Dr. Hank McCoy's love interest is kidnapped by the Friends of Humanity as a result of her involvement with him.
Mojo Vision - X-men are kidnapped into an alternate universe and forced to fight for entertainment.
Disc 2
Reunion 1&2 - X-men team gets Xavier from the Mister Sinister in the Savage land.
Out of the Past 1&2 - Wolverine's past lover interest, Yoriko Oyama, returns him and the X-men battle an alien Spirit Drinker, precursor to the Phoenix Saga.
The Phoenix Saga 1-5 - Jean Grey is introduced to her Phoenix powers in order to save the galaxy from the evil Shiar Emperor, D'kin.
The Phoenix Saga:
Starjammers
reviews.title: Excellent DVD

reviews.name: Marvel Comic Book Collection: X-Men, Volume 2 (2-Disc) (Full Frame)
reviews.reviewText: The packaging was terrible... and it came without the protective sleeve.
reviews.title: 18 July 2011

reviews.name: Marvel Comic Book Collection: X-Men, Volume 2 (2-Disc) (Full Frame)
reviews.reviewText:
The Phoenix Saga was one of Marvel's best story arcs. It begins with Jean Grey receiving a dose of radiation from a solar flare which in turn triggers her psychic abilities to become the omnipotent Phoenix. Throughout this miniseries, other characters appear like the Emperor D'Ken, the Unstoppable Juggernaut, and Gladiator (by the way, there are no similarities between Gladiator and Superman!). Gladiator was one of the best characters in this series and I wish that they had shown him more often. Anyhow, I have no qualms about recommending this DVD.

In one of my other reviews pertaining to another volume of this set which featured a couple episodes of Mr. Sinister and the Nasty Boys, Marvel, for some reason, excluded Ramrod from the Nasty Boys. I think that was a very ignorant decision as this was a character of great interest.
reviews.title: The Phoenix Saga Was Well Made

reviews.name: Marvel Comic Book Collection: X-Men, Volume 2 (2-Disc) (Full Frame)
reviews.reviewText: I've been waiting for this show for years. This is a great release.
reviews.title: Finally!

reviews.name: Marvel Comic Book Collection: X-Men, Volume 2 (2-Disc) (Full Frame)
reviews.reviewText: I remember watch these shows on Saturday mornings with my kids. They loved the stories and animation. Now they are all collected on this great set. If you are a fan of the comics, then you'll love this DVD.
reviews.title: Excellant Video
